page.title: 01Loch Linnhes surrounds
page.content: My Scottish Western Highland area consisted of about half water, the tidal Loch Linnhe with a triangle of land on each side. The west coastal strip has the A82 road from North Ballachulish to Fort William alongside the Loch, with desiduous and pine forestery commission land inland offering a forest walk. The land rises up to become the mountains. Meallen Dane Phuim and Dare Dann. The east coastal strip is marshy but provides grazing land for sheep. There is a more minor road on this side of the waer with a mansion and private parkland providng grazing for ponies. Most of area is uninhabited,but in top right corner is the outskirts of Fort William with a few houses, offering bed and breakfast, and a hotel. There are few public amenities and no industry.
